etomica.math.discrete

Class PermutationIterator

  • java.lang.Object
    • etomica.math.discrete.PermutationIterator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IndexIterator, java.io.Serializable

    public class PermutationIterator
extends java.lang.Object
implements IndexIterator, java.io.Serializable
    Iterator that returns different permutations of a sequence of integers when called in successive iterations. For example, if constructed with n = 3, will return, in successive calls to next(), the arrays {0,1,2}, {0,2,1}, {2,0,1}, {1,0,2}, {1,2,0}, {2,1,0}.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • matrixPermutation

        public static int[][] matrixPermutation(int[] p,
                                        int[][] a)
        Returns a new matrix formed by permuting the rows and columns of the given matrix according to the permuation list p. The list p[i] is such that it gives the (row/column) index in matrix a from which the element of the new matrix is taken. So b(p[i],p[j]) will be equal to a(i,j). The original matrix a is unchanged.
        Parameters:
        p - permutation list
        a - original matrix
        Returns:
        int[][] permuted matrix
